problems.title: Check if Three Sides Form a Valid Triangle
problems.description:
Given three sides, check if they can form a valid triangle and print "Valid Triangle" or "Invalid Triangle".

For three sides to form a valid triangle, the sum of any two sides must be greater than the third side.

Input Format:
Three integers separated by space representing the three sides.

Output Format:
Print "Valid Triangle" or "Invalid Triangle".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 4 5

Sample Output
Valid Triangle

Sample Input
1 2 3

Sample Output
Invalid Triangle

Sample Input
5 5 5

Sample Output
Valid Triangle

Explanation:
Check all three conditions: a+b>c, b+c>a, and c+a>b.
hintsList: A triangle is valid if (a+b>c) AND (b+c>a) AND (c+a>b). Use AND operator to combine all conditions.
